comments.body:
Line 27, the import still references the beta 
```
test/integration/dualstack/dualstack_endpoints_test.go:27:      discovery "k8s.io/api/discovery/v1beta1"
```

i think the api/errors package would not tolerate a nil value for err here and panic:
https://github.com/kubernetes/apimachinery/blob/master/pkg/api/errors/errors.go#L480-L482
https://github.com/kubernetes/apimachinery/blob/master/pkg/api/errors/errors.go#L649-L654

should this be just `false, nil`?
:thinking: `errors.As(err, &status)` will not panic if err is nil, it will just return false IIUIC
you are correct. tested locally and `apierrors.IsNotFound(nil)` returns false.

should we use a small interval for resync but not 0? i can see that [NoResyncPeriodFunc](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/pkg/controller/controller_utils.go#L105-L108) is used in other tests and it returns 0 too).

we don't want resync here, just to process the event as is, there is only one worker to serialize the events too
Importing a function just for this does not seem worth, right?
yes, importing NoResyncPeriodFunc is not needed.

note, create returns a NS object but does not actually create it using a client. also delete is a no-op:
https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/test/integration/framework/util.go#L48-L64

@sttts  kindly helped me with this, it seems that the integration framework does not check for the existance of namespaces, however, the tests uses the right URLs

> I1027 11:11:40.380932   70653 request.go:581] Throttling request took 196.832197ms, request: PUT:http://127.0.0.1:35039/api/v1/namespaces/test-endpointslice-dualstack-3/pods/test-pod/status
I1027 11:11:40.383711   70653 httplog.go:89] "HTTP" verb="PUT" URI="/api/v1/namespaces/test-endpointslice-dualstack-3/pods/test-pod/status" latency="2.35047ms" userAgent="dualstack.test/v0.0.0 (linux/amd64) kubernetes/$Format" srcIP="127.0.0.1:45852" resp=200

this pattern is used in other test, so I would left as "Work as expected" :smile:
